Reviews.Title: “Oldie but a Goodie!”
Reviews.Author: txgal55
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but the hotel is beautiful, very clean, room was HUGE, and staff was friendly. Only allow valet parking but rate was low-end average for Dallas area hotels ($24).

Reviews.Title: “Warwick Melrose Hotel Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Emily H
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful boutique hotel in a great location in Dallas. We held a dinner event for our foundation honoring a local legislator and everyone in attendance was extremely impressed with the hotel and the service of the hotel staff. There is a nice restaurant and beautifully restored bar that is open to the public. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting Planners Dream”
Reviews.Author: Joan P
Reviews.Content: We recently had our annual Sales Managers Meeting at the Warwick in Dallas. I must say that in my 30 years of planning meetings, this was the best experience I have ever had. This exquisitly maintained/rennovated property built in 1924 has a unique charm and character. The service was above the top on every level. The Sales Manager, Deanna, was extremely accomodating from beginning to end. The Director of Catering, Cynthia, was simply unbelievable. I am extremely picky when it comes to my corporate meetings. She exceeded my expectations on every level, which has never happened. The quality of food as well as the presentation was out of this world. The rooms are so beautiful and beds are top of the line. Eeryone in the hotel bends over backwards to help you and always with a smile. My managers were so impressed with everything. Out of my group of 35 I did not have one complaint. Even the invoice was a breeze being easy to read and very organized and detailed. The location is perfect being 5 minutes away from tons of upscale clubs and restaurants in the prestigious Uptown area. I highly recommend this little Oasis for business meetings, family or a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Easter Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Mary B
Reviews.Content: Our family of 7 adults, 2 babies and a bird dog traveled from AR, LA, DC and TX for our second, perfect gathering at the Warwick. We were high-maintainance, at best, and every request was beautifully. We had four rooms, one a suite that was large enough for us all to watch the Master's while the babies slept in pack-and-plays in the bedroom, which was wonderfully quiet and dark. All our rooms were spacious and comfortable. We are accustomed to older homes, so we loved the feel of the furnishings. This was our second holiday buffet there and we were not disappointed. Our first trip was last Thanksgiving and the menu was about the same, with an extensive breakfast and all the Easter favorites included. They did run out of crab claws but I think our group put a fairly good dent in the supply. At check-out, I had to tell the front desk that we had swapped chairs, ice buckets, linens and glassware from all the rooms to another and it was all too garbled for us to straighten out... and just like needing to dump smelly trash from our carried-in seafood dinner and baby yuck, the front desk at least acted as if it was their pleasure..such patience! Our dog received a box of treats and toys and it was so nice to have her welcome. You can see the way the hotel looks on the website and it is lovely, but it's the people that work there that made our trip a success.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely older hotel, beautifully restored”
Reviews.Author: dms1878
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice at this hotel and it is beautiful. Good service and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Style”
Reviews.Author: TravelWell040
Reviews.Content: A spur of the moment weekend getaway was rewarded with another stay at the Warwick Melrose. The staff is always helpful and courteous. When visiting Dallas the Melrose is the only hotel we stay at. Old world class, spaceous clean rooms, and great location close to the major highways are a few of the reasons this hotel is our choice. The renovated Landmark restaurant is a must while staying there. The food and service are excellent whether it be breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaB64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Warwick for a dear friends wedding. Coming from another state, the Warwick made my travel a piece of cake! When I arrived, the staff was eager to help carry my bags and assist me to my room. The rooms were BEAUTIFUL!!! Plenty of room, VERY CLEAN, and a comofortable bed. They were very kind and helpful throughout my stay. The most friendly staff I have ever encountered at a hotel.The Warwick was also convienty close to dallas love airport. I would highly recommend the warwick to anyone traveling to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old hotel”
Reviews.Author: GSi_Bailey
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Warwick Melrose this past weekend for a reunion. Beautiful old hotel that has recently been updated. Lobby was stately and nicely appointed. Room (had a corner King) was surprisingly quiet and comfortable. Bathroom was older but adequate. One problem: no light over the shower/tub so it was kind of dark in there with the curtain closed. The Library bar was somewhat small and VERY LOUD - so much so that we moved into the lobby just so we could hear each other talk. Overall, a very nice hotel - great service and personnel. One "complaint" is that internet service is pricey and not included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: emmasue1
Reviews.Content: This is an old world renovation and quite lovely. Staff and services were top notch (front desk, bellman, valet and room service)...our only (minor) complaint is that our suite was a connected suite to another room (or suite-we don't know) and the accoustics between the two suites (a not very tightly fitted older door) allowed us to overhear the next door party as though they were almost in our sitting area! Thankfully, they were moderately voiced and the door that separated our sitting area from the bed and bathrooms did close off the sounds of next door; but next time (and there will be a next time as otherwise we loved it hear!), we will ask about this when we book our room.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nlm14
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel! spacious rooms! I stayed here for a wedding i attended, and it was absolutely beautiful. The breakfast is fabulous! All the staff is friendly and very helpful! Had the best time ever at this hotel... I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Blake T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bachelor party and the room sizes were great for a little pre party action and everything was super clean! Had the Salmon Benedict for breakfast and even though I live in Seattle it was the best I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: davisb2900
Reviews.Content: I go to this hotel every year for my Anniversary. The rooms are great, the staff is wonderful and very attentive. I love the hotel bar "Library". Everything about this hotel is classy. You will not be disappointed. You are close to everything in the city. Courtesy car took us to our restaurant. I would recommend this hotel over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Friendly attentive staff, wonderful rooms, comfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: Bob J
Reviews.Content: Love the cieling fan in the room. Old world charm and true Texas warmth. Stayed there on business for 3 days, enjoyed every one of them. My daughter stayed with me and used the coutesy car to sightsee Dallas. Class act and classier staff. Food was fantastic. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during an event at the convention center.... And it was great! Our room was great! Everything was very nice and comfortable. My only complaint was when we called the shuttle to pick us up from a restaurant a block from the convention center, it took them over an hour to get us because the driver got lost... Yet we told them the exact intersection! Besides that, absolutely no complaints...

Reviews.Title: “The Warwick is Outstanding for Historic Character and Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: goochpg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Dallas for a week on business this past January, and chose the Warwick for its historic character and charm. This is not a chrome and glass cookie-cutter hotel chain...it has a stately charm that distinguishes it from the usual big city boxes. This hotel does have some years under its belt, and the hallways may seem a little narrow and dark, but the service is first rank. From the front desk staff to the seamstress we were treated with exceptional friendliness and caring. We received a special rate for the week of our stay, so the relative smallness of our room (it did have a king-sized bed & writing desk) was compensated for by the excellent price. We enjoyed the Library Bar's cozy, friendly atmosphere, and we found the food in the restaurant particularly good for breakfast. There are a couple of quaint little restaurants nearby that are worth a try...particularly an indian-themed vegan place just down the street. All-in-all, the Warwick provided a pleasantly distinctive experience in Dallas and we would happily return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Dallas gay neighborhood. Great for fun or for business travel.”
Reviews.Author: KevinInSouthBeach
Reviews.Content: The Melrose is an elegant, historic, well maintained hotel in the heart of a gay entertainment district. Rooms are very comfortable. I love that they have soft music playing in the room when I arrive. I love the restaurant for Sunday breakfast, although it is great at anytime. "The Library", their bar, is upscale and relaxing. Rooms are comfortable, with great beds. Great touches, such as soft music playing when you enter the room. My only complaint is the price of parking. The room price is fair until you add a $23 parking fee. Then, the price is not so reasonable. There is plentiful free street parking, so the fee does not make sense.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cattlemanGH
Reviews.Content: Took the little lady to the Melrose for Valentines and it could not have been better. We were offered an upgrade to a larger room for $7. The room had a sitting area, desk, very comfortable king bed, and a very large bathroom. Staff was great. The only negatives was the $24 parking and charge for internet. We loved the Library bar. It has entertainmet most evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, stately”
Reviews.Author: ls1202
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Melrose for one night. This hotel is so elegant and stately. It was built in the 1920's and has undergone a complete renovation in recent years. We stayed in a corner room/suite with a king size bed. The room was HUGE... full sitting area, desk and bed were in one very large room. The bathroom, closet area is in a separate room and again the bathroom was HUGE. 'Just absolutely gorgeous. Luxurious bedding - glassware (including wine glasses) - a coffee table with top tier local magazines - floor to ceiling drapes. The staff were friendly and offered excellent service. 100% no smoking. 'Only valet parking and they charge $24.00/per night! Even though the neighborhood is probably not one in which you would want to park on the street, this exclusive/expensive parking policy always takes me back a bit. But what does one do? The Melrose is not doing anything that other downtown hotels in other cities do but it still seems like a rip-off.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juptown74
Reviews.Content: As a former 12 year resident of Dallas, I know where to go, and where to avoid. When my trip to Dallas was being planned, the Warwick Melrose was my hotel of choice. From the charming structure, with all it's lovely architectural details, to the fantastic location & welcoming staff - once I arrived I knew I had made the right decision. My room was spotless, comfortable, and tastefully decorated. My special instructions for breakfast by room service were followed without fail. The staff made me feel welcomed, important, and accommodated my every request, cheerfully. Even sending a housekeeper to steam my shirt at the last minute, before I scurried away to host a very special dinner. The property maintains a very nice SUV, which gladly dropped me off, as well as picked me up, several times around town during my stay; an immense convenience. I travel often, always staying in the finest hotels, and would stay no where else. The Warwick Melrose is my hotel of choice in Dallas. And that's saying a lot, in a city with so many upscale properties to chose from.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt have been better!”
Reviews.Author: greengalcalgary
Reviews.Content: This fabulous old hotel was welcoming and comfortable, I couldn't have been happier to have the DMC book me here! Our room was spacious and spotless. The bed was wonderful and the room is beautifully appointed. We enjoyed the dining facility and really loved The Library bar. The staff are friendly and anxious to please. The convenience of having someone drive you somewhere for dinner and pick you up is amazing. Can't wait to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at LaQuinta”
Reviews.Author: nrnskm
Reviews.Content: This place was so not what it was cracked up to be. Yes, it's historical and that's about it. The most upsetting - you arrive and you have no option to self park and valet is 24/night. Crazy. Internally, it feels like a haunted hotel, beetlejuice - the people are all librarians looking like they are half dead and hate their jobs. Very cold atmosphere. There is one person at the front desk and she is annoyed when you ask a question or has to service you. The rooms are spacious but stink, dirty, the hallway is terrifying, no security and loud. I love gays but it's definitely a gay hang out, probably not the best place for families. I can't imagine anyone providing a great review for this place. Pros: Good internet rates, conveniently located for business, reasonable bar prices, gay dating/travel. Cons: Unfriendly people, high prices for in-room services, valet only option at 24/night, cold people, historic but old and stinky, not customer service driven (at all).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 'n' friendly”
Reviews.Author: DonnPearlman
Reviews.Content: This is an older property but it is clean, comfortable and the staff members were extremely friendly during my recent two-night visit in January 2012. The desk in the room conveniently had three electrical outlets for plugging in laptops or other mobile devices. There's a 24-hour Walgreen's across the street for any on-the-road items or medications. This was my first visit to the Warwick Melrose, but I certainly would stay there again on a future visit to that area of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bathos13
Reviews.Content: Fantastic staff. Well maintained hotel. Very nice room but maybe a bit on the small side. Good location. The car service comes in handy for dinner and a few drinks, The on site bar (Library) is very cozy and friendly. My only complaint (if it is one) is that the clientelle is considerably older. We had a great rate and our room was super quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom sink and shower/tub leaking”
Reviews.Author: Reybythebay
Reviews.Content: Cozy and clean little room (#516) but the lavatory sink hot water leaking as well as the shower/tub faucet. Staying only 1night pointless to be bothered by repair if reported while staying. Will report at checkout. Turned off hot line in sink for now. Rb Torres [--]

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Christmas stay”
Reviews.Author: farmerswife3590
Reviews.Content: This was an elegant surprise, as we were looking fora hotel near our son and daughter-in-law's condominium. It was especially nice for my 89-year-old mother-in-law traveling with us. She doesn't want to ask for special treatment, No ADA room was available, but they were able to discreetly put a shower seat in the tub for her.

Reviews.Title: “Best Wedding Ever!”
Reviews.Author: udallasart
Reviews.Content: I had my wedding reception at the Warwick Melrose. The staff there are the most hard working, attentive, and happy people you will ever encounter at a hotel. The true star at the Warwick Melrose is Bethany B., the wedding coordinator. Because of her careful planning and wise counsel, I had countless guests tell me that our wedding was one of the most beautiful and most fun they'd ever been to. Thank you, Bethany and all the staff at the Warwick Melrose! P.S. The food was incredible too!

Reviews.Title: “They Don't Make Hotels Like This Anymore”
Reviews.Author: travelingAggie
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has been renovated well. It still has a classic look and feel. My wife and I stayed at this hotel in mid-October as part of a block of rooms reserved for a wedding. We were given a discounted rate because of the wedding. The service and attention to detail was very good. Our room was spacious and included a king-sized bed, sitting area, desk and good-sized bathroom. We had drinks at the bar in the lobby and that was great too. Parking is limited and I would recommend using the valet service because parking on a nearby street would be difficult. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Save by the Manager at the End...”
Reviews.Author: SDHapahaole
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for work purposes prior to a national exam which is hosted in Dallas and had a very mixed experience. Apparently, the Warwick has been the hotel which hosts all exam candidates for 7+ years, which is why I was a bit surprised that they booked a deafening holiday party in the hotel for the same night prior to my exam. While I can't speak for the rest of the 60+ nervous examinees scheduled the next day with me, I really didn't gain confidence the night before my big exam from the Black Eyed Peas being pumped at full volume from 6 floors below and the reverberations of the bass into the courtyard. I could hear the DJ word for word despite turning on the AC and putting in ear plugs. When I called the desk, I was told that due to the contract signed with the party group, no control could be exerted on the volume and that I would just have to "tough it out." I was also told that there were no other rooms available in the hotel to which I could be moved to try to get some peace and quiet. I was livid. Despite the lack of a restful night, my exam the next day went fine. Upon check out, I complained again about the combination of a raucous party the night prior to the exam and the manager was very apologetic - to the degree that he comped my room charge in an attempt to make up for the inconvenience. He saved this review from being a 1 star by doing so. Otherwise, the hotel is quite stylish, rooms (I had a King Supreme) spacious and well appointed - the fitness room leaves a lot to be desired - however, the hotel contracts with a huge gym across the street for which they offer $10 day passes. Room service is just above mediocre (unfortunately the hotel restaurant was closed while I was there) All I really needed the night before my exam was a quiet night. I'm still a little flummoxed that the hotel is the host for a huge national exam which likely brings them 2,000+ guests each winter, and yet they were so greedy and short sighted to contract out for a huge party the night before an exam day and which was destined to disturb all of the candidates.

Reviews.Title: “Tradtional Comfort in a Vibrant Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: DRS_CA
Reviews.Content: Even for those used to staying in hip, designer boutique hotels, the understated, traditional charm of the Melrose is refreshing. Providing the feel of a classic European grand dame hotel, the Melrose offers a welcoming lobby, unusually large, well appointed guest rooms, and a location in in the appealing Turtle Creek / Oak Lawn neighborhood, equally close to Park Cities posh, Dallas' world class Arts District, the many restaurants of a newly vibrant downtown and midtown, and a lively gay bar scene. The hotel itself houses the cozy, buzzy Library Bar, along with a white-table cloth restaurant where large sunny windows attract a power breakfast crowd. On top of all this, the hotel is an unusually good value, with frequent internet specials. The downside is the bathrooms which could stand some updating. Another odd deficiency is the fact that the hotel has no news stand, and in order to obtain a paper other than USA Today, a guest has to walk to a nearby drug store. Despite it all, on my frequent trips to Dallas I never stay anywhere other than the Melrose. It's like visiting the comfortably frayed apartment of a rather proper, stylish aunt, who happens to be surrounded by all the best that Dallas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic Texas Charm”
Reviews.Author: Tomstah
Reviews.Content: These hotels are precious, they exude a comfortable grace and a lived-in appeal - and when I say lived-iin I mean it the most complementary way. The wood is old and real, the Library Bar is the genuine article (that many new hotels have copied with their cheap veneers) and despite its years it still offers a fabulous aura of elegance and sophistication. Of course the yuppie riche might be fickle and offer criticism of the not over the top service or that you still have to pay for room wifi access, but this hotel is about authenticity that has endured fashion rather landed to it, confident in its offering. The rooms are not dated, they're aged like good wine: ifyou like staying in a sleek bleached wood veneer and smoked glass iPod pod, then this isn't for you, but if you can appreciate a fine room for its refinement and quality then please do I love this hotel. Trip Details: We stayed for 2 nights as family of 4 in a double room. The room was spacious, well appointed and clean. The staff were friendly and polite, the breakfast was good. Big Plus: - the courtesy car which offers a shuttle service to anywhere within a 3 mile radius of the hotel. Perfect for getting downtown. Little Minus: $11 per night for room wifi access. Overall: excellent value

Reviews.Title: “Classy Elegance Without the High Price Tag”
Reviews.Author: Kid55
Reviews.Content: After countless, disappointing stays at the Park Cities Hilton, I decided to stay at the Warwick Melrose and I'm here to tell you, goodbye PC Hilton! The Melrose is now my new go-to hotel whenever my travels take me to Dallas. You can not beat the location and top-notch service and hospitality. From the valet to the front desk, you are treated with the highest degree of courtesy and respect. Yes, this is an old hotel but that also equates into more spacious rooms with some unique character. Plus, while I was there in June, they offered complimentary canteloupe lemonade in the lobby. How refreshing is that?!? And the bar can not be missed! All in all, the Melrose is a keeper, offering comfort and convenience at a very competitive rate. You will not be disappointed! Try them for a refreshing change.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite!”
Reviews.Author: metaldealer
Reviews.Content: Of the 10 or 15 times I've stayed at the Melrose I can honestly say not one involved a bad experience! I love the fact that I see the same staff EVERYTIME! The valets, Luis at the front desk, and Leon the bellman somehow manage to remember my name each time I come in! Are the rooms dated as some have said? Yes, and I LOVE IT! Besides room service(which is prompt and perfect) Ive never had to call for anything. Tons of pillows on the beds, plenty of towels,and always emmaculatly clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Tired of the same ol', same ol'?”
Reviews.Author: G M
Reviews.Content: The Warwick Melrose Hotel, located on the edge of downtown Dallas, provides the traveler with a pleasant and comfortable alternative to high-end national hotel chains. Think "a little bit of Europe" in the US. The Landmark restaurant is one of the best in Dallas, the Library bar is friendly and comfortable, and the staff attentive and responsive. Built in the late 1920s, the Melrose offers very comfortable, old fashioned style with modern amenities including wi-fi, exercise facilities, valet parking and a location close to much of the Dallas "action." While the standard rooms are very acceptable, the corner suites, especially those facing west, are wonderful. We don't and won't stay anywhere else in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, elegant hotel with lively bar downstairs”
Reviews.Author: We_Work_4_Vacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after a wedding reception and it was very nice. The front desk was very helpful and booked us at the discounted rate for our wedding party even though we booked at the last minute. The architecture is classy and our room was nicely appointed. There was a fully stocked minibar in the room that we had the will not to utilize. There was a little noise from the room above us but nothing that was too out of the ordinary for most hotels. The valet parking was a little steep at $25/night but it was nice not to have to walk anywhere to get our car. The Library Bar in the lobby was not your normal hotel bar. It was packed on a Saturday night and seemed like a great place to hang out even if you weren't staying at the hotel. Overall a very satisfying stay.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: maintzmo
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel...it was converted from apartments so there are many variations of rooms and none are like the typical hotel room. We were in a wedding that was held at the hotel, the reception was at the hotel, and we had a block of 18 rooms. I went in a few different rooms and love them all. The Fine Arts Suite is gorgeous. The hotel staff made the experience lovely! We got such beautiful pictures n & around the hotel, too.

Reviews.Title: “A Most Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: misterlorens
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for Thanksgiving week and really enjoyed the entire venue. Room was spacious and comfortable, the bar area was cozy, warm, and surprisingly affordable. Conveniently located to all points of interest within Dallas. Charming staff. Old World elegance. Highly recommended and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it... not even close.”
Reviews.Author: Joseph K
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as part of a medical conference in November. This got me a group rate of $185 for my room and I still felt ripped off. There were some positives. The staff was very friendly, for the most part, and tried to be helpful. It is also fairly clean. If you like having a mini-bar, the one in the room was quite extensive and well stocked, and the pillows were especially soft and comfy. There was also good hot water. That is about it for positives. Where do I begin with the drawbacks of this hotel? First, after checking in, we realized the thermostat in our room had dead batteries, one phone was non-functional, and there were lights out. The thermostat was fixed within an hour, the phone never fixed, and the light bulbs changed after about 4 days. Also, they provide your own ice machine in the room... a neat feature... except ours was broken and never fixed or replaced. The location was not great, either. If you want to get downtown you cannot walk and have no easy public transit option. You really need a rental car at this hotel since you are a good distance from most places you will want to go. While it was not a big issue for me, it should be noted that the hotel is also located right in the heart of a vibrant gay community in Dallas. Each night during our stay we observed cross-dressers outside the hotel and were approached about our interest in certain "shows" twice. My biggest issue at night was the noise. Even with my room on the top floor, the street noise poured right in. The whole night is filled with sirens, loud honking, people shouting, and so forth. Walls are also very thin. People on our floor were having parties until the early morning hours on two nights and we could hear everything they were doing and saying. The room set-up also seems poor. There is a very nice TV, and it is about 25 feet from the bed and about 18 feet from any sitting area. They put the chairs and bed on the far opposite side of the room, and that made no sense... the remote could not even reach that far so you need to stand up and walk over to the TV if you want to turn the TV on/off, change the volume, or channel. The bathroom was tiny with barely any room for personal items, and a tiny antique shower. Closet space was minimal, with 7 hangers total. I requested two wake-up calls... one came 35 minutes late and the other 20 minutes early. Seriously? Finally, the extra costs are very, very high. Internet is $12 per day, valet parking is your only option and it is $25 per day, and the bar/restaurant are very high-cost. Drinks are about $10 at a minimum and it was $19.70 for a grilled cheese with a cup of tomato soup ($15 + $2 service charge + 18% automatic tip). I just didn't get it. They seem to present themselves as a luxury hotel and certainly charge you a price that reflects it, but I have had much better stays at basic chains like the Holiday Inn, Best Western, or Courtyard. Do not stay at this hotel unless you absolutely need to. I already contacted the heads of this medical conference and advised them to change the hotel next year. For the price you will pay, there are FAR, FAR better options in Dallas or the general DFW area.

Reviews.Title: “A Last-Minute Success”
Reviews.Author: Lemiracle
Reviews.Content: I was sent to Dallas with little notice on a two-day business trip a few years ago. My colleague and I were literally driving into the city from DFW and scrolling through hotel options when we more or less blindly settled on the Warwick Melrose ecause it was fairly near where we needed to be the next day. As it turned out, it was a terrific decision. This was a grand, old hotel, and I appreciated its charming touches. If you're looking for slick, this isn't it. The staff was very friendly, and my room was large, old-fashioned and comfortable. We were in town on a Sunday, and we enjoyed an absolutely delightful brunch in the hotel restaurant. Not only was the food terrific, we soaked up the atmosphere. I distinctly remember a group of gracious women, dressed in their Sunday best after church, celebrating a birthday at the table next to us. They were delightful (their accents too) and we couldn't help but do some eavesdropping. The location was also a nice surprise. The hotel is located near the Oak Lawn and Turtle Creek neighborhoods, a few miles from downtown Dallas. The neighborhoods are affluent and pretty, with several good restaurant options. The first night, we simply walked down the block and found a good Mexican plan, the second, we drove to a fantastic old-school burger joint (alas, the name escapes me). We had a little downtime, and the hotel made a good base of operations to see some sights, including Dealey Plaza and the Book Depository museum, and the Ft. Worth stockyards. Lastly: while I can't promise this always holds true, we were pleasantly surprised to get a very reasonable rate. The hotel is worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Large room good location”
Reviews.Author: neurodoc01
Reviews.Content: Nice historic hotel. Huge suites good value. Would be better hotel with better concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Some Nice Cosmetic Touches, But...”
Reviews.Author: Mardenco
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Warwick for business (location), making my reservations through the hotelâ€™s web site. I had been planning to stay there for some time as the appeal of the structure seemed inviting. (I have stayed at most area hotels.) I enjoy old hotels and understand that you have to overlook issues with maintenance, but the Warwick needs more attention, both to the structure and the staff for the business traveler. My suite was large, but not in excellent repair. Sure, it had a fresh coat of paint on textured stucco walls (like you see in a cheap remodel) and the decorating style was a bit lost on me. But the living room A/C made so much noise, you could not talk on the phone while it was engaged. The bathroom amenities, towels and linens were of mass-market hotel style, and there were issues with the plumbing and electrical outlets. And, you have to enjoy the flight path from Love Field, which apparently goes right over the hotel. The friendliness of the staff escaped me on this trip as there was barely a word uttered in my direction, even when ordering at the Library Bar. The restaurant was closed, which I was not told of in advance, so there was no opportunity to comment. The â€˜charmâ€™ highlight was the Library Bar â€“ it is well done and the musicians were great, although I did not find the wait staff very cordial. Some of the old architecture is quite nice. For the money, you should go to the bar, enjoy the piano, and youâ€™ll see what you need to see of the Warwick. The renovation at the Stoneleigh is of a higher caliber and more comfortable. From reading the other reviews, it seems like they do wedding much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel/Great Rate/Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sooner86
Reviews.Content: This old classis property has been remodeled and is a beautiful example of a period hotel. Elegant and refined, rooms are unique and well appointed and the staff is great. The Library Bar is a perfect place to relax and even eat. The restaurant is elegant is is in the beginning stage of a remodel with a revamped menu. Great location near downtown and Love Field. Great rates and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding party”
Reviews.Author: Orliss S
Reviews.Content: All phases of the Warwick, Dallas service was excellent. Our coordinator, Deanna, did a great job for all of our guests. From valet to waiters all personnel were exceptional. We will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Style”
Reviews.Author: TravelWell040
Reviews.Content: Once again we stayed at the Warwick Melrose. This hotel has managed to maintain its charm and style while and not cut corners on pleasing customers. The front desk is friendly, the valets are efficient and courteous, and the Landmark Restaurant staff attentive. The rooms are spacious, clean, and comfortable beds. The hotel is located near the major highways and not far from downtown. We consider no other place to stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience.”
Reviews.Author: Charkle
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel. Staff were excellent - Steve, the valet, greeted us warmly as did the front desk staff. Room was clean, comfortable and spacious. Bed was extremely comfortable and after a long flight was just perfect. The Landmark restaurant was first class and we can definitely say was the best dining experience we had in the USA. All in all, a fantastic experience and a great welcome to USA for Australian travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomdenverDenverCO
Reviews.Content: If you like historic hotels in great locations, this is the hotel for you. I stay here at least 1 time a year and keep coming back. This classic hotel is a charmer and is located close to great shopping, dining and nightlife. The rooms are nice and of good size. Great views of downtown Dallas if you get a room facing that direction. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room but front desk rude”
Reviews.Author: fair s
Reviews.Content: First, you Will pay for valet parking, unless you insist to park your car along the street. Next, the evening front desk attendant was rude to the point of embarrasing us when we had questions. The foyer was beautiful and clean as was the room. Very, very nice. You Will pay $7.00 for a bottle of water in your room, and breakfast is not complimentary. Now, we have stayed in hotels and paid similar room rates, but received more in the way of complementaries and respect. Unfortunately, the rude front desk attendant set the tone for our stay. The other attendants were extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star hotel, old world charm in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: fdipace
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and each time it gets better. The hotel is located near Turtle Creek and Oak Lawn. If you enjoy older classic hotels this is a must. The doors and walls are solid, its like sleeping in a huge Mercedes! I've never heard any noises from other rooms. The furniture although an older classic design is beautiful. The bed is extremely comfortable and so is the linen. The marble bathrooms are fantastic. Although an older property everything works great...water pressure,water temperatures, A/C, internet, flat screen tv etc. Usually older hotels are noisy and have inconsistent water pressure and temperatures...not at the Melrose. It is first class. The bar is a must, don't miss it. There are several casual eating establishments in the area but you will need to drive for more upscale restaurants. Parking is a little steep for the area but at least your car is safe. If you are gay the hotel is in the heart of the gay village. Check the hotel for specials you would be surprised at the rates. Enjoy, I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: avmiddleton
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Melrose for business/pleasure in Uptown Dallas. Our room was fabulous--- spacious, well appointed, with super comfortable beds. The gym facilities were nice, on par with some larger, chain hotels. The hotel was incredibly quiet, which was great for work and relaxation. The location is excellent for walkability, as there are tons of shops, restaurants, and bars nearby. The only criticism we had was of the service in The Library (bar). The first night we were there, we were essentially ignored by the waitstaff. We thought it was a fluke and returned a few nights later, only to be ignored again. Our drinks were still enjoyable, we just were forced to hunt down our waiter for both our drinks and our tab. Regardless, we'll visit The Melrose again. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recent Stay Was Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Warwick Melrose again and were pleased as always. The Landmark Cafe is really enjoyable and the Library bar is absolutely fantastic. We used to stay in north Dallas when we came but much prefer this location. The restaurants in this area of town are so diverse you can find anything you could possibly want! Too many to name but all within easy driving distance. This Hotel is just the right size. It is small enough that the staff will get to know you if you stay there just a few days. Always one of our favorites!

Reviews.Title: “Evening away!”
Reviews.Author: kingofthehill81
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were looking for a night away from the kids and didnt want to go too far. we stumbled on the Warwick Melrose on a list of top historic dallas hotels. I am extremely happy we chose this hotel. Everyone that worked there was extremely friendly and it was great. Having to pay for valet parking was a little off putting at first, but after making a trip or two downstairs it was worth every penny, never had to wait and the parkers were always in a dead sprint. We skipped eating at th hotel but wish we would have. the Libary bar was fantastic, it had everyone from people in tuxes to people in hawiian shirts, and they were all treated equally! the live entertainment was phenomenal and she was not only singing but also working the audience and posing for pictures. If your looking for a romantic night away this is it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Finally got to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Bryce C
Reviews.Content: I've lived in the suburbs around Dallas for years. I've driven by the Melrose many times and told myself I would stay there one day. Me and my wife finally stayed there for a overnight getaway for her birthday. The Melrose did not disappoint. Great location. Great service. Great historic building. Great people - both employees and guests. Not a bad thing to say. Hope to go back again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: CyclingGeo
Reviews.Content: My new bride and I spent our wedding night at the Melrose (honeymoon will be in two weeks in Italy). What a great choice! The room was so comfortable and our dinner at the Landmark in the hotel was quite memorable. We had not provided the restaurant with information that this was our wedding night, but my wife mentioned it and they produced a wonderful complimentary dessert tray with champagne. Our waiter Charlie was instrumental in facilitating this treat. The hotel staff, from the front desk staff to the parking valet, were incredibly friendly. We were having dificulty getting our room key card to work and and a housekeeping lady in the hall came to our rescue. This is a one-stop destination, as you will never need to leave the hotel. Great for locals who might want a night or two away and great for leisure travelers or business travelers who would like a hotel in a convenient location with a lot of class and comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay here when in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: ppipe
Reviews.Content: The Warwick Melrose is an excellent hotel! The service and quality is superior and the location could not be better. This was my second time staying here and both experiences have been wonderful. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: candle1976
Reviews.Content: I came into Dallas for two days on a business trip and our travel person booked me at the Melrose. I had previously stayed at the Adolphus and as nice as it was; it was a little sterile and was so nice, you were afraid to touch anything. The Melrose has the same sort of higher level vibe, but the staff and aura are much more down to Earth. It was the best night's sleep I have ever gotten in a hotel, thanks to the comfortable bed and peace and quiet in the room. I will stay there any time I'm in the big D.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: This month my wife and I stayed at the Warwick Melrose for a quiet couple of days away. We couldn't have been happier with everything from the location to the detail shown by the staff. The valet staff was exceptional and went above and beyond. We had no issues through our entire stay but I'm confident if we had, this wonderful staff would have handled anything that came up with flying colors. Price was reasonable as well. The corner king room was roomy and the beds were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: aussiewill
Reviews.Content: Great location and great hotel. There was a mix up on arrival because some of the party arrived a day late due to weather problems back in Australia. One member of the pary arrived on time. We had prebooked our whole stay. When the remainder of the party arrived there was confussion with the booking and it took 1/2 hour to sort out. Not what we needed after a long 15 hour flight. But overall the hotel is great. When we left they gave us a lift to the hire car place with their curtesy car. Big clean rooms. Great bathrooms and comfortable beds. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great ambience”
Reviews.Author: dodge4x4rules
Reviews.Content: Loved the room. Front desk staff late night left a bit to be desired but overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtfully appointed boutique hotel in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: DCDoctor
Reviews.Content: The Melrose is a beautiful property surrounded by interesting shops and restaurants. The spacious room was spotless and clean. It had the modern conveniences needed without being overly frilly. Very comfortable bed with an excellent HVAC system that managed the August heat wonderfully. My favorite hotel in Dallas and I am here monthly.

Reviews.Title: “Melrose Hotel is a pristine, first class, unique hotel with old school grandeur and timeless charm.”
Reviews.Author: Aggielrh
Reviews.Content: Hi, My name is Lori Henegar and my husband and I always consider it a huge pleasure to be able to stay at the Melrose. We love the cozy, setting the hotel rests in when we drive up to the valet to stay. Service is first class from check-in to incredible gourmet room service selections!!! My husband loves to have a martini in the chic' Library Bar and for myself a glass of French rose' from an impressive wine list! The rooms are richly decorated and spacious. We love the size and cozy retreat of the Melrose and would not stay anywhere else in Dallas for the accommodations and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: SDF44
Reviews.Content: They just tried to rip me off $10.00 for a mini bar charge when I never used it. I always purchased across the street at Walgreens as a bottle of water in the room was $7.00 and only $1.39 across the street. The first person I called was rude to me and sent me off to accounting after a few seconds. Is this a scam or an oversight? Be careful and watch your charges. Even take a picture of the mini bar lock untouched if you have to.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel, good bar & restuarant but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: markrotoole
Reviews.Content: Staying just one night at the Warwick Melrose for business, I was impressed by the classic feel of the hotel. It almost could fit in New England with its ornate lobby and pretty exterior. Inside it was nice and clean, though a bit outdated. Rooms were spacious; mine had a galley kitchen, which was interesting. The bar was subdued but nice, and the restaurant served a good, but expensive, meal. Overall, this was a decent hotel, easy to get to from the airport. But there was not much more than the hotel. There were no grounds to speak of beyond a small parking lot. I did not get out to see the area, but we didn't seems to be near anything of note.

Reviews.Title: “Well renovated historical property”
Reviews.Author: wpg01
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my stay and will definite come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: fickle-n-precious
Reviews.Content: Service was perfect. The hotel manager sent up a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered cherries on the house at the mere mention of my reason for staying....3rd wedding anniversary. This is a very nice boutique hotel. The King Corner Suite is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FundingPro
Reviews.Content: The Melrose is pretty typical for these kinds of historic hotels that have been renovated. It has quirky rooms that may be considered charming to anyone who doesn't live in an old house, good service, and a thriving bar scene. Parking is atrocious, and you'll end up getting nickle and dimed for things that would be free at a Hampton Inn, but then again, that's pretty standard for these kinds of places. The people that are regulars just love it and are very loyal. I'll probably stay there again provided I can get a rate less than $150 which is what I did last time. At that price it's a steal for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a special birthday!”
Reviews.Author: Trickster1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and Library Bar! This hotel and the staffs special touches and attention helped to make a memoriable birthday for my mom!

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel. A great bargain for the suite size and the excellent service”
Reviews.Author: OdessanWhoTravels
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel because the staff is helpful, the service is attentive, the food is great, the piano bar is jazzy, the location is perfect. Whether we ask for in-room massages, a shuttle to a nearby restaurant, in-room dining after a hectic day, appetizers in The Library that are so good they become an elegant dinner, or just sitting in the lobby to people-watch, we have never been disappointed. We've been staying here for many years. Every now and then, we'll go to another hotel in Dallas. Never fails, we always say, 'big mistake.' Need to stay with a sure bet of a great stay. That's the Warwick Melrose. On this particular journey, we traveled to Austin the same weekend. Staid in suites both hotels. Warwick Melrose = huge comfortable suite = $230. Second Hotel = not as large suite = $1,000. Need I say more? Betsy

Reviews.Title: “Faded grandeur, more faded than grandeur.”
Reviews.Author: Strider462
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a fine old hotel. The front desk was occ. helpful but more often virtually asleep and uninterested. As if no one is running this place. The rooms are large but dowdy. Bathroom products were not readily replaced as needed. There is a nice shuttle service when available to nearby sites and we used it. We had some internet problems and staff tried very hard to help. The lobby is nice, the bar is gorgeous, with excellent drinks and live piano music. The hotel felt empty and stagnant. The location is not great. Not a great value. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: richy_roo75
Reviews.Content: We had a "Corner King room" , large room, nice bathroom. The sheets are quality, high thread count, great mattress & pillows. We chose this hotel to be close to the "gay area" of Dallas but wanted a nice hotel not some "gay hotel" if you know what I mean. The Melrose met all our needs above & beyond. We will be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: CRUSHPHL
Reviews.Content: Over the past year, have been a frequent guest at the Warwick. The rooms are spacious, service is great, and the Library Bar is charming and fun. But what really sets the Warwick apart from other hotels is the staff. From the valet service, to the bellmen, to the front desk mangers, to the bartenders and waitresses in the Library and Landmark, everyone is friendly and goes out of their way to insure you have a pleasant stay. CBR Philadelphia

Reviews.Title: “Average room, not a lot of 'extras' included”
Reviews.Author: BoulderCO_Adam
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, clean and fairly standard fare. It was strange that the hotel does not include free wireless or internet ($10 extra); breakfast ($$ extra) or parking ($25/day!) especially since most other hotels in this price range *do* include those things. The hotel is in a nice location, but I think there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “we like it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Claudia-m-larrea
Reviews.Content: We had our daughter wedding reception at the Melrose it went great. Many family members and friends stay ant the hotel and they were all pleased with the polite service all raving about the rooms nice and elegant. We will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: MelroseFAN
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and the staff is first class. From the valet staff to the manager they all treat you like a jewel. This is my favorite place to stay in Dallas, and I never want to leave when I check out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: roseguinea
Reviews.Content: When driving up to the hotel, I was worried because the building looks really old. But it is deceiving because the interior is first class. It is clean and the rooms are nice. The bathroom, especially bathtub, needs updating. The surrounding area is great with many places to eat within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel -- little problems.”
Reviews.Author: agilina
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and have stayed here many times but hadn't been in a bit. I hate to drag around a laptop and refuse to use an Iphone but do like to check my email a couple of times a day as I have an internet business. They used to have a complimentary computer -- now they have a "business center" where you are charged 35 cents a minute to use the computer. WiFi is #12.50 a day. Insane when even the Hampton Inn has free computer usage - free WiFi and free computers on site. Too, they also have valet parking right on their property and you can see you car from where you stand on the hotel steps. Instead of just walking to your car you have to wait and for that priviledge pay $25 a day. Also, the hotel is old -- which is one of the reasons we like it -- but I noticed on this trip the wooden windowsills on the outside are in great need of painting. Again -- great hotel with problems.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: aggiealum08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 2 year anniversary, and will definitely be heading back. The staff was great and they upgraded our room with no charge upon arrival. It is historic, so don't expect the super sleek, modern feel of some other local hotels, but we enjoyed it even more due to those differences. The rate was awesome and has been the best value I have found in the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Staff, service, location and character/charm are first class!”
Reviews.Author: five99
Reviews.Content: We have a six year relationship with The Warwick Melrose...we had our wedding and reception there and return every year to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWell040
Reviews.Content: Once again we were treated to a quet, romantic weekend at a hotel that retains its elegant bygone style. Valets, house keeping, and desk personnel are friendly, courteous, and try their best to make our stay the best. The room we asked for was unavailable because the previous occupants did not check out until 30 minutes until we arrived late in the afternoon. But, the staff arranged for us to get a better room in the same stack. Don't miss the restaurant, the Landmark, which has an excellent selection of wines and a superb menu. I wish all hotels were as caring and quiet as this one.

Reviews.Title: “The Warwick is now my favorite hotel by far! What a discovery :-)”
Reviews.Author: bda_terri
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly impressed with this hotel, from the rooms, to the service its exceptional employees provided. This was my first (and hopefully not the last!) visit to Texas and surely an impressionable one. I came down for a wedding which was being held at the hotel and the location could not have been better. The valet, reception and bar staff were some of the best I have come across, and this is based on stays at hotel chains such as Fairmont, Ritz Carlton, MGM Resorts and many other fine hotels all over the world where I have traveled with my family growing up. The beds were beyond comfortable also. I can honestly say that I was 110% happy with my stay at the Warwick, and if I had not had to leave and return home, I would not have! I would absolutely choose this hotel as my chain of choice if there was one in any of my future destinations. The bonus point was that the group rate for the wedding was unbelievably affordable for me. Unfortunately, based on the regular rates, I would likely not be able to afford to stay in the same choice of room for more than a night or two in the future if I was not to travel with my wealthier family :-( But I am glad that I was able to experience it, as it made me want to come back to Dallas very soon, and absolutely back to the Warwick if funds allow. Also, for anyone visiting, Saturday nights in the Library Bar feature a singer named Aubree-Anna. She was AMAZING and I wish she could have performed more than that one night during my five-night stay. Hopefully I will see her on tour someday! I'd like to especially commend David Swanner who took my reservation as he was most helpful and prompt with his responses.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service - boutique hotel feel”
Reviews.Author: Richmond-VA-Barb
Reviews.Content: Stay here on a regular basis for business. Large well appointed rooms, very clean, superior service from all staff members. Consistant high level of service and great accommodations over the past two years of staying here. Lobby bar is a great place for relaxing. Work out room is modest about 10 pieces of equip each with their own attached TV as well as a weight area - all very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Warwick rolls out the 5-star treatment!”
Reviews.Author: JTay55
Reviews.Content: Took advantage of a free night's stay at the Warwick to celebrate our anniversary and had just a great experience. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful from the time we arrived to our departure. For an older hotel, I was very impressed by its overall condition and our king suite was very comfortable, clean, and nicely appointed. The Library Bar is a must, with live entertainment every weekend. We had the pleasure of enjoying one of Dallas' best, singer/songwriter Aubree-Anna. She's got it all, and it made me think of Billy Joel's line in the song, "Piano Man,"......."man what are you doin' here....." But, I'm glad she was. Would highly recommend this hotel for anyone heading to Dallas, or for those of you already here who just want to get away!

Reviews.Title: “Eh, ok at best”
Reviews.Author: Newmanhwdfl
Reviews.Content: Lovely old property they tried bringing into the 21st century. My room was ok, it had a very squeaky fan, very annoying. The Ac system was very loud and cycled a lot. Overall I did not sleep well and then was awoken by a fire alarm. The bathroom was nice but the shower was very low end, it was a $20 bathtub with a shower head and curtains, I expect more in a nicer hotel. And the single most annoying thing....$24 a day parking, outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, will return.”
Reviews.Author: snowconcious
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas with my husband for a conference and stayed at Warwick for 5 days. We fully enjoyed my stay. Our room was very nice, impeccably clean, very good bed and pillows, lots of room. We went to the hotel's restaurant (the Landmark) the first evening and liked it so much that we ate there every day. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We were treated with respect and care. We will definitely stay there again next time we are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, GREAT room, Great time!”
Reviews.Author: mommyoftwo
Reviews.Content: I apologize for the brevity of this review, but we unfortunatly did not get to spend a lot of time at the hotel on our trip. I booked this hotel at the last minute for a getaway with my husband. We didn't arrive until after midnight (saw a late movie at a theater, then had ice-cream... it's amazing the little things you want to do when you don't have your kids with you!), so I called the hotel close to midnight to let them know we were on our way. The gentleman who answered the phone was very understanding, told me it was no problem, and to come to the front and he would take care of everything. My hubby dropped me and the front door and the gentleman had already alerted the valet to park our car for us (we certainly didn't expect them to park our car at midnight). They unloaded our vehicle, were very friendly, and went out of their way to help us out. The bed was SUPER comfortable (and my husband is very picky about his bed!). The hotel is contemporary and luxorious, and the location to downtown can't be beat. We will definatly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great old hotel-if it only had a pool!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WYSOKC
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th stay at the Melrose and it was again perfect. I took my chopper down there for a bike show and they let me park it right by the fountian overnight and kept an eye on it and my trailer for me. They even helped me load it up when we left. Great service as usual. The regular rooms are very nice look but we always opt for the Corner King and it is great. Ask for it early as these sell out quickly. Nice sitting area, bigger bathroom and tons of windows. If you can, ask for a room away from Oak Lawn as the traffic going by can get a little loud on the weekends. The Library Bar is without question the coolest, hippest old bar in the USA and I have gotten cocktailed all over the world. Great drinks, great music, great service in an atmosphere that looks like you walked into a 1920's movie. Sink into one of the big chairs and enjoy the ride. And speaking of "rides", the hotel has a very nice shuttle service to take you anywhere you want in downtown dallas and he knows his way around very well. One of the most overlooked features of the hotel is the restaurant. Great food for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Have eaten there a dozen times and seen 3 movie stars in there as well. Its a beautiful place with windows on 3 sides. Only draw back for us is the lack of a pool. I understand it is an older hotel and that was not really an option back then but when Bid D gets hot, its nice to cool off in a pool. All in all, we will continue to go back, just not in the heat of the summer!

Reviews.Title: “A Wedding Dream”
Reviews.Author: mdheyen
Reviews.Content: We had approximately 45 rooms at the Melrose for our daughter's wedding. It was a beautiful setting with absolutely wonderful service. Everyone felt so special, in fact two of out guests commented that they decided they would move in!! An experience you shouldn't miss

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful in all ways”
Reviews.Author: diamondboy1957
Reviews.Content: The stay here is always very professional and wonderful. We have been here many times over the years and love to stay here in perfect part of town and easy access to everything. We would highly recommed this hotel to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place overall”
Reviews.Author: kewlguy919
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this weekend, booked the room thru hotwire. Was totally suprised at the convenience of this location. It was very quiet but just down the street from some night clubs and lots of shopping/restaraunts. The staff was really nice and check-in took all of like 3 minutes, it was very quick! The only thing I didn't care for was the bed. We stayed in the king delux room and the bed wasn't nearly as soft as I'm used to in 4-star hotels, but it wasn't necessarily uncomfortable either. The room decor was very nice and the view was pretty good too. Parking at $24 was not fun either, that really annoyed me.

Reviews.Title: “An exquisite old-world hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: havaneasy
Reviews.Content: If you seek an elegant hotel in North Dallas, very close to downtown but removed from the downtown hassle, this is the hotel that I would recommend. I have stayed here many times on business and can say that the service is superb, the dining is excellent (although it is also close to some very fine restaurants), and the service is white glove but not pretentious. The staff is responsive, friendly, and welcoming, and I feel treated like a guest in their home, not a random business traveler. And the price is quite competitive. If you're looking for chrome, glass, and a high-rise experience, this is not the place, but if you like warm ambience, a civilized bar scene with nightly entertainment, personalized service, and privacy where it counts, check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gwen1956
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Warwick Melrose for an overnight stay in Dallas. From the moment I was dropped off at valet to entering my room, was a most fabulous experience. The hotel is very old world charm and is very beautiful. The staff was amazing and very courteous. I had the pleasure of eating and what a pleasure it was. The food is very, very good and was worth the visit alone. This hotel will definately be where I stay in all other visits to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, relaxing, surpsingly comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ldfalco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a very pleasant surprise. The staff was warm and courteous. The room was superb! Large with two very comfortable beds. Great desk and wireless internet connection throughout the room. There are only two recommendations that I have for the hotel to improve the overall room experience: The closet needs an independent light inside the closet and the tub/shower, also needs a light. Aside from those minor recommendations I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and highly recommend anyone to stay at this Landmark hotel.

Reviews.Title: “classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndestin
Reviews.Content: An older classic luxury hotel in a convenient location. We asked for a room with a view and received a stunning view of the Dallas skyline. The room was a little smaller than I expected but was very comfortable. The Library Bar attracts what seems to be a combination of hotel guests and locals and was extremely pleasant. We had breakfast in the main dining room and were very happy with our meal. The neighborhood is mixed. It is nice to walk down to Turtle Creek which is a few blocks away. Pick up a snack/meal at Eatsies along with a bottle of wine!

Reviews.Title: “Well-situated landmark historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: xiphe
Reviews.Content: We had a corner king, and the light from all the windows was very good. Decor is a little dated/old fashioned, and the best that could be said of the bathroom was that it, like much of the hotel, is very historic. Low water pressure also suggests historic plumbing. Bed was very comfortable, with plenty of down pillows as requested. Room was plenty large. Although I would not consider this a luxury property, I sure prefer this to a cookie cutter kind of place. The staff were friendly and available, but a room service tray sat neglected in our hallway for several days and was starting to turn nasty, and why the maids who obviously service the rooms did nothing about it, I have no idea. We arrived after 11pm, and the lounge was about to close the kitchen, but the staff were very kind and allowed up to order very tasty club sandwiches with french fries. Valet was silly expensive. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay again Once Again”
Reviews.Author: TravelWell040
Reviews.Content: Once again we traveled to Dallas for a weekend stay at the Melrose. Everyone from the valet parking, lobby desk staff, bell hops, and restaurant staff were polite and efficient. The Deluxe rooms are large with high ceilings. The rooms are clean. Through December 2010 there is an 86th Birthday Special that cuts rates by almost in half. Do not miss dinner at the Landmark Restaurant. We had two dinners and breakfasts in the restaurant. The food is excellent. In December 2010 they have a 3 for $30: appetizer, entree, dessert, and a large sample of their house wine (Columbia Crest) that is worth every penny. One may also order food in the bar called The Library which is just as good. We have never liked food at a hotel restaurant (that includes high end hotels in NYC) until we tried the Landmark. I think this is one of the best hotels in the US.

Reviews.Title: “I never fill these out, this is how PERFECT my stay was at the Warwick!”
Reviews.Author: fwsmith1980
Reviews.Content: This was the prefect hotel. The staff is wonderful. The rooms are amazing. I loved the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facility with superb, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: eh836
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel not of the chain mold, with large comfortable rooms and an exceptionally friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with a gem of a restaurant”
Reviews.Author: looby73
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 2 nights, following a hectic 4 nights in Las Vegas and a night in Fortworth, we stayed in a corner king room, it was beautifully decorated, the bed was comfortable, bathroom good size and clean. A little disapointed that there was no complimentary water (not paying $7 for a bottle of water), went over to walgreens across the road for water. The best part of this hotel is The Landmark Restaurant, we decided to go there on our first evening, and was blown away, the staff were professional, polite and very knowledgable about the food, was a lovely surprise to be served a delightful 'amuse bouche' complimentary from the chef. The restaurant, service and food was so good we decided we would eat there again on our second evening! My favourite item was the asian calamari starter, so good i had it both evenings, followed closely by the choculate muffin for dessert. We visited the Texas State Fair, which was good fun and passed a few hours, and the hotel provided a complimentary drop off in local area, so we used that to visit The sixth Floor Museum. The poor chap had lost his voice, hope it has finally returned!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Melrose”
Reviews.Author: austinmdpedi
Reviews.Content: This is a great old hotel close to downtown while still having a neighborhood feel. My wife and I stay here on our twice a year weekend getaways to Dallas. It has character, wonderful rooms at a good value, excellent accommodating service, a great bar (The Library) and a fine restaurant (The Landmark). You could spend a couple days and never leave the property and have a wonderful stay. It is a vintage hotel with all that charm but with modern bathrooms and amenities. You can spend A LOT more and get a bit more (better food, nicer grounds) and stay at the Mansion. We find this is a good compromise. The public places are great, though there are no great outdoor spaces. And you are surrounded by a WALGREENS, Office Depot, the hotel parking lot and the like. One side does face an attractive Methodist church. But the rooms are big and for $150 a night the corner King offers all we need. Nice enough views. Lots of windows. A big comfy bed. Nice bathroom. Large seating area with couch and chairs etc. Desk. All the computer access you need. Only big downside is that Valet Parking is now $25.98 per night including tax. And if you bring a car it's required. Add the tips and that kills some if the value.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Opulence at a jmore reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: R.ching
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic property located in the uptown area of Dallas. The rooms are advertised as being "over sized" and they are right- we have stayed and several different historic hotels over the years and this one really was quite spacious. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have every slept on- you can really get a good nights sleep. The hotel staff was very courteous and helpful, the hotel offers a courtesy car that will take you any place within a three mile radius of the hotel. One driver in particular was very helpful and informative, if you get Leon you will indeed be fortunate. The Landmark restaurant in the hotel was excellent and offered delicious entrees (we had the lamb) and the service was perfect! The only negative would be that the room internet service was a separate charge although free wifi was available in the lobby. The Warwick is a keeper when in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel outrageous valet fees”
Reviews.Author: Citgo
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Really enjoyed the room and The Library (bar, bistro, live music 7 days a week). Staff were professional in every way. Valet, at $25 a day, is overpriced. It takes this hotel from good value to terrible value. I struggle with this decision, but I would not stay there again because of the amount of the valet fee. Otherwise this is a fabulous hotel. If you are not concerned about the fee don't hesitate to stay there. It is 3 mins to the Tollway, 4 mins to Hwy 35. Close to a Starbucks and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: amcarroll
Reviews.Content: We all know the hotel is gorgeous, but I did not know how great the rooms are. We walked in to our King Superior Suite and could not believe how large the room was. We had a large bar area, study area, living room, dining room, master bedroom, and master bath. The hotel, service, rooms, restaurant (we ate breakfast there), and Library Bar were all fantastic. My grandparents were with us and my grandmother's exact words were "After staying here, I am never staying at the Adolphus again" (and trust me, she is hard to impress). A+++ all around!

Reviews.Title: “Best Luxury Experience Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: rlmurray1
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant, luxurious hotel with the most friendly, courteous staff!! The room was beautiful and I didn't want to leave the bed fit for royalty!! I was pampered at my ever turn. The library bar had wonderful music and the staff was an absolute pleasure!! I will be back very soon. The hotel is located not even a block from the most hopping clubs with all the beautiful people!! It was better than being at home!!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Treat”
Reviews.Author: gridskipper
Reviews.Content: In the middle of a business trip I somehow ended up at the Warwick. I rolled up in jeans and a t-shirt and was overwhelmed with the elegance of the place. It was the first time I felt under-dressed for a hotel lobby. Vintage is not usually my aesthetic, but it is a lovely contrast to the rest of Dallas, which seems to have been built entirely in the 80's. More importantly, I forgot how wonderful it is to have solid wood doors, real windows, and a room that is almost totally soundproof. And you don't have to make any compromises with bathroom fixtures or an internet connection. All in all a lovely stay. I hope I get more surprises like this down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas Gem - Perfect if you want something Charming/Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: TRGAdMan
Reviews.Content: i stayed there for a wedding and the entire trip was wonderful. The hotel bar is one of the very best i have ever been to and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The old world feel of the hotel blends perfectly with modern luxuries and amenities. A must for people who love cool hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jperkin1
Reviews.Content: Spent just an overnight in this hotel for a wedding in the area. From dropping off our car to picking it up the next day, the staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. The valets, who were running from the hotel to get cars (in the 100 + degree heat), were so nice and so impressive with their kindness and hospitality. The room was large and the bed very comfortable. I am a bit embarrassed to admit that we left some items...:( however, when I called they said they would be happy to mail them to me and it was not an issue. I would definitely stay there again, and hope to do so! It does cost $25.98 to park there for an overnight (let's just call this $26.00, shall we??), which is a nice thing to know in advance...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service & beautiful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: JC104
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Warwick Melrose was FANTASTIC! When we arrived, the valet was there to greet us on a very busy Friday evening and welcomed us warmly. The hotel and lobby area is beautiful in itself and definitely stands apart from your average upscale hotel--the decor is stunning! They even have a bar with an awesome cocktail menu, not to mention, great live music/piano bar!! We spent much of our time at the bar during the evenings and it was a perfect way to end every night. The rooms were definitely spacious and so comfortable & clean! If you are looking for a fabulous, clean, comfortable hotel that is centrally located to several restaurants, bars, lounges in the DFW area, you should DEFINITELY be staying at Warwick Melrose!

Reviews.Title: “Most gorgeous hotel in Dallas...”
Reviews.Author: txlonghorn07
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this place. The room was beautiful with a classy, cozy feel. The staff is super friendly and quick. I didn't try the restaurant, but ordered this pasta dish through room service, which was delish and came super fast. One definite plus was the hotel's bar (Library Bar). Great drink menu, and they had live music/piano. I loved that the performer sang all these modern songs with an old school jazzy vibe!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding personal involvement”
Reviews.Author: B52Gun
Reviews.Content: Friendly very professional staff. No problem with small pets. Outstanding dining and experience. Very helpful valet parking staff and reception answering every question and full of good advice on all area ammenities. Very peaceful and relaxing, outstanding views of the city and within short walking distance to resturants, shops, and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation Nicely Done”
Reviews.Author: Mplstraveler99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here about 4 years ago and found the rooms shabby and need of a renovation. On this trip we had heard the hotel had been renovated and wanted to try it again. Very nice renovation on the rooms. We found a package deal on the hotel web site for a suite. Room 501. Beautifully redone room in keeping with the historic hotel's image. The bed was not upgraded and it was very firm. Little closet space but over all very nice room.

Reviews.Title: “The Warwick Melrose Hotel - Dallas exceeds ALL expectations!”
Reviews.Author: DavidBeerley
Reviews.Content: The Charm and elegance of the Warwick Melrose Hotel - Dallas is evident when you pull into the valet parking. As someone who travels extensively I was highly impressed by the speed of check-in, and the staff's knowledge of virtually everything Dallas. The rooms were spotless - the beds were very comfortable - and room service was dead-on in both quality and speed of service. The neighborhood surrounding the hotel is extraordinarily clean, and there are a number of shops and restaurants within walking distance. However, I strongly recommend you eat in their restaurant as the food is nothing shy of exceptional! The bar was busy, and the patrons were fun and interesting. Again, the speed of service was notable. In short my family had an amazing time during our extended stay, thanks in large part to the fabulous staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsasaki
Reviews.Content: Service was great, i didn't spent long time there, but staying was good. Valet parking is a bit overprice though

Reviews.Title: “Grand travelin'--old school style”
Reviews.Author: Blah_b_dee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, capacious rooms. From an era when folks traveled with big trunks. The rooms are h-u-g-e and the bathrooms too. Really just a lovely place. But note: an old hotel is, well, an old hotel, so the gap between the elevators and the floor may be a bit odd, etc. I was thinking that this might be one of my favorite hotels ever, just about the time that a bunch of loudmouths had a meet'n'greet out in the 7th floor hallway. At 11 in the PM. But, hey, what can you expect from a great hotel in a hip part of town? Still though, it's a lovely place and I'd stay again without hesitation. PS The oatmeal in the dining room is tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: ellencarroll27
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Melrose over the Thanksgiving holiday in order to be close to family in the area. When we checked in there was no one at the front desk and after a long wait a bellman finally took us to the room. There was a problem with the kitchen so we could not get coffee or breakfast the following morning. There is only valet parking behind the hotel which we had to pay for daily and every time we left to go to my father's house which was frequently, we had to ask for the car. The worst part of the stay was the room. It was very worn, very poorly lit, and the housekeeping was the worst I have ever experienced.
