I was so exhausted from going back and forth from the hotel and my father's house that I gave up trying to get anything done about the multiple problems. I travel often both nationally and internationally and found my stay here to be completely unacceptable for the money I paid and the service that is advertised.

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN & COMFORTABLE BUT UGLY FURNISHINGS”
Reviews.Author: emannh
Reviews.Content: The Warwick is a classic gem of a hotel in a wonderful neighborhood with good restaurants within walking distance. The first 3 nights of my stay were perfect great AC and quite, unfortunately the last evening was Saturday and they had a wedding party with a band which played until 12:30 and loud guests running the halls â€˜til 2 am. I would chose this hotel over the Crescent which I have stayed at multiple times and had numerous problems. In my opinion the Melrose and Stoneleigh are the best options if you want a 4 star hotel in this near downtown area with a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like being Home with friends...”
Reviews.Author: palmtrees4mc
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise! Arriving in Dallas to meet friends and they made my reservations at the Warwick Melrose Hotel. The experience will have me back each time I travel through Dallas. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel with outstanding staff and service!”
Reviews.Author: Ozark1
Reviews.Content: This hotel made me feel like I was back in time when service meant something. The entire staff called me by name and made me feel extremely welcome. Their bar is wonderfully intimate, their restaurant lovely and inviting. The rooms are very spacious and have that sort of class to them that harks back to the hotels of days gone by. I left there today wishing I could stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip to Dallas superb!”
Reviews.Author: Becky2750
Reviews.Content: The Warwick Melrose was a wonderful experience. The room was pristine with comfortable beds, a large bath and plenty of towels. The restaurant has excellent food and the service was personable and great. Staff is friendly and seemed genuinely concerned with insuring we had a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Melrose Dallas was and excellant experience.”
Reviews.Author: EJEmpire
Reviews.Content: The accomodations, service, food and total experience was excellant. I have stayed in many 5 Star hotels around the globe and this experience was one of the best. I would highly recommend this hotel and resturant. Ther room was confortable and the bed and bedding was plush and very confortable. The food in the Landmark Resturant was excellant. I also had an excellant in room dining experience. I received excellant service from friendly and professional staff from the valet parking attendent, check in staff, bellman and all the service staff. I will definitely return to this hotel during my next visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Bachelorette Party Ever”
Reviews.Author: AliVZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous! We were immediately greeted by the smiling valet service even though we had a ridiculous amount of bags for 3 women. The guys graciously unpacked my car and loaded all of our stuff on a cart to be brought to the room. We checked in easily and went directly to our room. The rooms are beautiful! When the doorman brought our bags up to the room, he saw we were decorating for a bachelorette party so he offered to go get us ice so we could keep decorating. The staff was such a delight! And, we were able to comfortably have a bridal shower with 8 women in the room; plus a huge bathroom so we could all get ready to go out after all the gifts were opened. The entire weekend, the staff went out of their way to serve us. If you are looking for hotel for relaxation, for fun or for romance this is the hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Uptown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: DalTexRob
Reviews.Content: I was met by a friendly valet who welcomed me and asked if I was checking in. He offered to assist me with my one overnight bag but was considerate that I was willing to carry it myself. He asked if I would be going back out later and I answered yes, and he informed me he would keep my vehicle close. The front desk personnel welcomed me and asked for my name. Once given, they welcomed me back for another stay. I was very aware they were helping another guest and were so very nice to them as well, offering information to the out-of-towner about a museum she had inquired about. They told her where it was and that the hotel car could likely take her. I thought it was very nice how they treated her. Got my key and went to my room. It was lovely (as always) with all the amenities (iPod dockable clock radio, internet, flat panel TV, clean (really CLEAN!) and well stocked. I love the Melrose's old time charm and elegance with all the latest amenities. Breakfast the next morning was incredible. The greeter was so delightful and had an accent from I'm not sure where and also had a great sense of humor. The waiter (Jeffery) was so very attentive and made recommendations and it was a great experience. Food was excellent as always. I especially enjoyed the yogurt and fruit choice. My friend's ham was exceptional as well. A speedy checkout with very thoughtful front desk personnel and I retrieved my car and was once again on my way. As always, the Melrose offers old time luxury and service with all the modern conveniences and amenities. Describe the service you experienced Tell us how you liked the room Talk about the location & amenities Say what you liked best & least

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: TexasHappyWanderer
Reviews.Content: The Warwick "Melrose" Hotel is a legendary Dallas treasure. My grandmother took her granddaughters to tea at the Melrose on special occasions in the 1960's, so I thought it would be a fun place to stay. My husband and I were delighted! Our room was very large, beautifully decorated, and included all of the bells and whistles you would expect in 5 star lodging - without the normal 5 star cost. Our rate was comparable to any chain hotel found along a highway. Valet parking is required, but quite convenient and also comparable to parking fees charged in any large downtown hotel. If you're looking for a quite, romantic stay in a beautiful part of Dallas, you can't go wrong with the Melrose.

Reviews.Title: “They wanted to make me feel important!”
Reviews.Author: MzLindaLu
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with friendly, prompt and personal service. They always remembered my name! Room service was punctual and delicious, as were any meals I enjoyed in the restaurant. I had a wonderful stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: HankyPoo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were travelling with my brother who is from Canada to Texas to see family. I chose this hotel primarily for its location to Al Biernats steakhouse and was not disappointed. Reception was quick and easy, the rooms very spacious and lovely with all the ammenities. There is a nice bar where we had drinks before dinner. I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Dallas either for business or liesure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: tryan999
Reviews.Content: In 6 or so stays of 4-5 days each I've never encountered any hotel personnel that were anything other than friendly, helpful and professional. The food and service at breakfast are also excellent - only had dinner there twice, and it was wonderful but pricey. Rooms have been redone in the recent past and are very comfortable. Be sure to ask for a room with a dresser. One minor change in recent stays is the lack of a USA Today at the door - they are now available by the elevators on each floor. The Dallas Morning News is available at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, elegance and high class service.”
Reviews.Author: eliza81
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely worth the price. You get what you pay for in terms of ambiance, service, quality and overall feel upon entering. All the staff was extremely helpful. The hotel, though an old building, was clean and well maintained. My only complaint would have been the shower head and a bit of draftiness from the windows. Loved, loved the bathroom and vanity. Room was spacious. Lot's of mirrors.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in a wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dslovesvegas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Warwick Melrose Hotel for a getaway. Even though we live in the Dallas area, we love to "get away" for a night's stay every now and then. We have stayed in many hotels in the Dallas area and we always try to choose a different hotel each time and The Warwick Melrose Hotel is the best. When we arrived at the hotel, the valet parker was very nice and welcomed us. Check in was very quick and friendly...maybe 5 minutes at the most and they explained a lot about the hotel during that time. The room was large and nice. Obviously, we had a king size bed. Comfy bed. Bath robes and coffee maker....thank goodness for the coffe maker because I have to have my morning coffee. We ate in the restaurant for dinner and the food was fantastic. Not too expensive...I would say about $50 per person but we did have wine and that does add to the bill. The bar was quite busy for a Saturday night. We didn't go in but we stood outside and listened to the singer who was great...not sure what her name was but I would love to go back just to hear her sing again. Off to bed. Room service for breakfast and it was really good. I had pancakes and wife had fruit. Hot and fresh and the waiter was very nice. Checked out and home we went. I just have to say that the hotel was really great and very nice and beautiful. We got a deal at $169 per night and it was worth every penny. My wife really enjoyed herself and commented that she would love to go back sometime as we were driving home. Hmmm....we do have an annivesary coming up.

Reviews.Title: “The Warwick Melrose Hotel Dallas surpassed my EVERY expectation!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler051
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the Melrose property, I experienced true GUEST treatment! it is lovely! The rooms are tastefully appointed and grand; the lobby, Library Bar and Landmark Restaurant are beautifully decorated and a joy to experience. The service throughout the hotel is impeccable. The Landmark Restaurant afforded attentive service, an elegant menu and artful presentation of delightfully delicious food. The location provides easy access to all Dallas has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: VLBerry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night to help a friend who was about to take an board exam. This is the hotel they want you to stay at the days prior to your examination. If you are coming in for ACOG, get some ear plugs because the street noise can be loud. We heard airplanes and ambulances on and off during our stay. It was not enough to ruin anything, but just a note. If you blink you are going to miss that this is a hotel. As many reviewers have said, this is an older builiding, and blends wonderfully with the surroundings. We had no doubt this used to be a swanky place to live. I was very impressed with the grand feel. The parking lot sits behind the hotel, and they only have valet. There is free parking on the narrow street that lines the hotel if you are brave. We were not. I can mostly comment on the rooms as we did not dine at the restaurant or visit the bar. The rooms were large and had nice seating areas and spacious bathrooms. One note of caution, the hot water in the sink gets extremely hot. I would not be surprised if guests have been burned. That can be dangerous for kids who turn on the hot water first before the cold. The beds were comfortable and there were flat screen Tvs. There is an IPOD docking station which made having great music easy! They had in room coffee makers and a mini bar. For you coffee drinkers, my mom did note that the creamer was not up to the level of a fine hotel-they could do better than the powdered stuff. We took the items out and used the fridge for our things. There was a large selection of free TV channels and lots of choices for paid entertainment. I was with my kids so it was nice to know that they had several episodes of kids' television shows and movies to offer. We eyed the room service menus and thought it was overpriced. No matter, we were 3 blocks away from one of my favorite places to eat-Eatzis. Its kind of a gourmet take away place where you can get fresh, hot food as well as made to order sandwhiches and salads. Walgreens is right across the street for any items you may have forgotten. The location is convenient to the expressway, about 2 minutes from 35E. In summary, this is a nice hotel and I would not mind staying here again. I do have a preference for newer things, so even with the remodel, I would prefer a newer, more modern hotel. Its similar to people who like the new construction house in the suburbs compared to those who like the refurbished Victorian downtown-just simple preferences.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Jem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelsTooMuch12
Reviews.Content: OK people letâ€™s be realistic. This is an historic boutique hotel and it shows. Do not come here expecting new construction. Anything vintage is going to have some quirks. The elevators are slow, but it just gives you more time to enjoy the wood carving in their interior. Yes there is some street noise which is why they will put you in the back of the hotel by default. I sleep with a white noise travel machine anyway so this is not an issue for me. The service is impeccable and friendly. The rooms (newly refurbished furnishings) are beautiful and far better than most hotels in the area. The rooms have more style and personality than even the Ritz Carlton in Dallas. Yes you have to pay for valet parking, but you can self park if you wish and the valet charge is half that of the W or the Westin. The room is less expensive too. There is a charge for internet, but most hotels do charge for this unless youâ€™re staying at the Hampton Inn or similar hotel. The Melrose is vibrant as is the area. There is a good restaurant and bar in the hotel, a steak house across the intersection, trendy coffee shop (Buli), home style cooking (Black-Eyed-Pea), casual fine (Bronx), Italian (Parigi), vegetarian (Cosmic CafÃ©), and very upscale Mexican (Cyclone) all within a one block radius. The workout facilities are acceptable, but you can go across the street to a full gym that partners with the Melrose for a reduced fee. I travel extensively to Dallas and am Platinum with Starwood, yet I choose to stay at the Melrose every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LaliBird
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The room was large, quiet and comfortable. The safe box and remote did not work, but both were repaired quickly. The lobby and Library bar are lovely. Valey parking is expensive and valet left our lights on overnight. We will come back and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: cswhitney
Reviews.Content: I must commend the beyond-the-pale service that the entire hotel staff extended to me on April 16-17, 2009. I was in a taxi/Bentley accident downtown while traveling alone on business. The hotel car took me to the hospital afterward. When I was released at midnight with a handful of prescriptions, one of the front desk staff walked me to the drugstore across the street to assist me. She also made me a sandwich because I hadn't eaten in 12 hours. The front desk kindly offered late check out so that I could stay in bed pending the arrival of my husband from Houston to drive me home. Frankly, the entire staff treated me with unexpected kindness and were constantly solicitous of my health. I recommend the Warwick Melrose to everyone who will listen, and I intend to stay there when I travel to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with Beautiful Rooms and Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: aussiecheer
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a beautiful hotel with great ambiance. This is the second time I have stayed and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Dallas! Front desk associates were very informative and friendly upon check-in and check-out. Didn't use the shuttle service this stay but took advantage of it previously and how nice it was (I believe it will take guests within a 2 mile radius). The rooms are spacious and not to mention gorgeous however I really enjoyed the luxury linens and the ceiling fan kept a perfect chill to envelope yourself in the bed. We enjoyed the lounge on the last night of our stay and the entertainment and ambiance was perfect! Needless to say, I'm a fan and would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to treat yourself to a luxurious weekend or just a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel with fantastic service and hospitality!!”
Reviews.Author: cararm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. The room was so clean it felt like home. The bed and pillows were so soft and the service from the staff was incrediable. I will stay there again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: francell
Reviews.Content: This past weekend I stayed at the melrose hotel in dallas, and was very pleased with the service and prossionalism of all the personal, as well the hotel amenaties which are by more than exceptional, with the fine dining and great entertainment this will be the only hotel of choice for me Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: sunracer68
Reviews.Content: You will be very happy you stayed at this hotel. Staff is trained well and very attentive. Rooms are spacious and beautifully furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Warwick Melrose Hotel was like becoming a queen for a few days."”
Reviews.Author: charryrn
Reviews.Content: The Warwick Melrose Hotel in Dallas is a beautiful, serene place. We felt like royalty and were treated with the utmost respect and like we were the only guests there. We were celebrating my birthday and although there were two very large weddings going on at the hotel during our stay, they treated us as if we were their only concern. We never had to wait a minute for an elevator or front desk assitance. The room was spotless everyday and very spacious and elegant. The parking attendants were friendly, helpful and so fast. The grounds are beautifully manicured and the location is phenomenal. You are just a few minutes from anywhere. We absolutely loved the hotel and will recommend it to everyone we know as well as stay there whenever we return to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wedding weekend atthe Warwick!”
Reviews.Author: JOYJOYPortAransas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a whirlwind wedding weekend where the wedding party and guests were, luckily for us, booked at the Warwick Melrose. Being from Dallas and having moved away 12 years ago, we were so gald to find that this was the hotel of choice as we always enjoyed going to the Melrose bar, The Library, after work. Trust me, if you enjoy luxury in a distinguished, beautifully maintained setting in the center of town, look no further than the Melrose, (AND at an economical price). The hotel is absolutely gorgeous from the crystal doorknobs, to the beautiful tiles, to the views, to the soothing music which greeted us in the room,to THE BEDDING which was heaven, yada, yada, yada. It was a wonderful oasis during a hectic event weekend. HOWEVER, Saturday night in this area DOES get a little crazy, but the valet will handle your car and the Library Bar is beautiful place to end your evening. We had a WONDERFUL time at this beautiful establishment. By the way, if you want a great breakfast or lunch, travel down Oak Lawn past Lemmon to Lucky's Cafe. A funky and wonderful diner with a full service bar. Quite the experience in itself.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: septimus41
Reviews.Content: As I write this review, I am sitting in the lobby of the Warwick Melrose. We came to Dallas on business, but also wanted to stay in a hotel that was also luxurious and romantic, at a reasonable price. We found all that at the WM. From the warm greeting extended to us by Leon, to the courtesy car driven by the super-friendly Chad, we were treated royally. Excellent room service and a great restaurant. The chef came to our table and talked recipes with my lady friend. Our suite on the sixth floor (601) was just remodeled, and was exquisite, with great views from our corner bedroom. Two 42 inch flat screen TVs, tasteful furnishings, and a spacious bathroom with great shower amenities, thick bathrobes--we loved it all. A previous review mentioned the sirens. This is accurate, but perhaps because we were on an upper floor, we did not find it disturbing--rather more of the big city coda of urban sounds. Only major complaint is that wi-fi in rooms is not complimentary, but at least it is in the lobby. I have mourned the long demise of good service in America. My experience at the WM has given me hope that there still exist at least a few places where it is still valued and practiced. You will find it here.

Reviews.Title: “A good 4* experience”
Reviews.Author: texhills
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a group event. The hotel is older, but very up-to-date and attractive. Our room was spacious and attractively furnished in the traditional way. Everyone in our party was very happy with the hotel. Apart from a double-billing error which took some time to sort out, I heard only compliments. I do think that charging for internet use is a bit aggressive in this day and age, however some luxury hotels still do it. That's one reason I give the hotel only four stars. The other was the very chilly lobby which didn't invite one to sit and people watch.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: TX1969
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Melrose in mid March for a weekend. I asked for a quiet room and received exactly that. The room had recently been renovated and had beautiful furnishing and a very comfortable bed. The best was the curteous and very professional maid service. Overall the appearance of the hotel is stunning and above a regular 4 star property. A real plus is that the hotel is very close to many restaurants and the Turtle Creek park. The hotel offers advanced booking rates that include the valet parking and the internet. Since the internet is $12 and the valet is $20 per day I would strongly recommend searching for these package deals.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: trece2009
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay. My room was clean, the staff was nice and helpful. I would stay here again anytime. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but NOISY”
Reviews.Author: doctunder
Reviews.Content: PROS: The hotel is nice and the service was wonderful. The staff was courteous and kind in most aspects. They have a courtesy car and driver to take you to many of the surrounding restaurants/bars The food in "The Library" bar is good but somewhat pricey ($15 for a hamburger/fries). CONS: The hotel is located about a 1/2 block from a Dallas firehouse. In my 3 night stay, I was woken up 4-6 times a night (and I'm a heavy sleeper) by the ambulance/firetrucks leaving the station. My room was on the 3rd floor and was overall pretty loud from the traffic. Additional considerations: High speed wireless internet was available in the rooms for $12/day. Parking was available for $20/day. I was there on business, however, if I would have been there for a romantic weekend, I would have been extremely disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but pricy..”
Reviews.Author: saminwp
Reviews.Content: No major problem during our stay. Nice size rooms and very good quality construction and amenities. Wonderful breakfast at the Landmark restaurant. 'Great staff and bar with classic feel. Location was good with lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Only when we were leaving, we were a little shocked ..the room charge of $160 p/n swollen up to almost $300 p/n. Well, mostly our faults I guess.. because we were told that the parking was $20 p/n, Internet connection $12 p/d, basic breakfast $25 p/p and list of taxes on the bill.. Was it worth it?? I will say Yes. Very charming hotel it was.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Warwick??”
Reviews.Author: jbrown84
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a couple friends and we were not particularly impressed. The service was fine, but the building just didn't feel like it was up to the luxury standards you would expect from the Warwick chain. There was a tacky red sticker on the inside of the elevator that said "watch your step". The light fixtures in the hallways were like cheap 15.99 units out of a cookie-cutter entry level home. The wallpaper, carpet, and overall look of the place was just very "homey", for lack of a better word. I know it's a historic hotel but I have stayed in many and it's not hard to decorate in a way that is modern while recognizing the history of the building. The sheets were VERY rough and scratchy--more motel 6 than Warwick. It's a great looking building on the outside, and the location in the Oak Lawn/Turtle Creek area is good, but that doesn't save it for me. If I hadn't stayed at a discounted rate through the Historic Hotels of America employee trade program, I would have really been upset. This luxury wannabe is not worth the full price.

Reviews.Title: “Get-Away In Dallas”
Reviews.Author: TXSusan
Reviews.Content: I had always heard about the Warwick Melrose Hotel, as it is a Dallas classic, but had never stayed there. I live in Arlington, but have family in Dallas, and decided it would be fun to get away for a night and see them. I booked a room and my family and I planned to start out at the Library Bar, as I had just read about its renovations, and have a few drinks. Well one look at the food menu there, and we decided we didnâ€™t need to move anywhere else. The bar staff was very nice and the live piano music made the atmosphere relaxing and very enjoyable. The room we stayed in was very nice as well, and spacious enough for myself, two daughters and sister. Everyone else that worked at the hotel was just as nice as the bar staff, from the valet guys, to the front desk, to management who made it a point to ask about my stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great place in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: karenp729
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here one night. It is our habit to try and stay in unique yet reasonably-priced hotels and this one fit the bill. The lobby is lovely and you really should schedule in time to spend an hour or so in The Library Bar. Our room was recently renovated although the carpet was already stained and one of the chair cushions had a chair. But the room was quite large and well-laid out. The bed was only moderately firm and comfortable and felt like it was time for a new mattress and boxspring. Some rooms near us were being renovated and we could smell the sawdust and paint from our room...which is probably why we got the low rate that we did! I ordered a hamburger from the restaurant for in-room dining. That was the worst-tasting most overcooked $30 hamburger I've ever had (I wanted the ahi tuna sandwich but they were out of tuna and offered me halibut instead...?). We could go back but I would request a room away from any construction and not order in-room dining again.

Reviews.Title: “An "honest" Gem of a jewel”
Reviews.Author: Larryo
Reviews.Content: Grand old historical hotel............ very comfortable, pleasant. Staff was exceptional. Many hotels have employees that just "answer" questions, but this staff went the extra distance and offered help. Splendid. Valet parking: I left my billforld in the car, and then 2 minutes after arriving in my room, the wonderful employee delivered the billfold to me. Thank you again, Warwick Melrose.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great service, noisy halls”
Reviews.Author: JHMPLS
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel is lovely, and the service from the front desk and the bell staff was very good. The location is great - near good restaurants and shopping. The room was nice - comfortable bed. Unfortunately, for two of the three nights there was a significant amount of noise from other guests, late at night, in the hall. The hotel handled the complaint well, offering one night free.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected!”
Reviews.Author: trip-kitty
Reviews.Content: I wished I had read the review from wanderer888 (June 13) to know what to expect. However, I have to say that I pretty much had no other choice as much as my stay, since this hotel was picked based on its location for the meeting that I was attending. This is an old building which is a historic landmark. The hotel staff is very friendly and professional. The room decor is okay. The lighting is good. The beds are reasonably comfortable. The the room size is larger than average. However, there are some issues. The heating system in the room is so loud that you have to pick a choice between sleeping or ambient temperature. They have a major moisture problem in the room. This is most likely due to combination of lack of ventilation/fan in the bathroom and all the sealed single pane windows where moisture condenses and drips onto the frame, panel and drips off from the wall. I had alot of respiratory difficulties throughtout my stay in the room as I have very bad seasonal/mold allergies. Also, I had requested a wake-up call which I never received. I had also ordered room service for 6:15 as I had to be at my meeting at 6:55. The food did not arrive until 6:32 after an inquiry call was made. For a 4 diamond hotel and 18% gratuity, I expected a timely service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: danubefish
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite for the Halloween party/parade weekend. Fantastically spacious. Four poster bed was a great touch. Close to great restaurants and bars. (Wouldn't stay here if you don't want to see gay couples because there are PLENTY of them about.) Will definitely book here again. I think I like it better than the Crescent Court!

Reviews.Title: “A gracious step back in time.”
Reviews.Author: DRace
Reviews.Content: We recently had a to find a hotel fast due to a family illness in Dallas. We needed somewhere convenient to the hospital and family and remembered the Melrose. My grandparents had stayed there years ago when they made a trip to the City (Dallas) and I always remembered hearing about it. It has been lovingly restored and if you are trying to get away from the current cookie cutter luxury hotel formula, the Melrose is the place for you. It was also an outstanding value for such a gracious and elegant hotel. The lobby and Library Bar were just beautiful -- elegant and understated. And I cannot rave enough about every one on the staff. They learned our names immediately and were always so attentive and considerate. Mind you, there were some minor complaints with the accommodations -- there is something to be said for new in some cases, but nothing that would cause me not to recommend the hotel. The only real complaint we had was that we could hear the activity in the adjoining room, probably through the connecting door, and next time I would ask for a room without one. We were on the back side of the hotel, so the street noise was at a minimum. Overall, we were very pleased despite the unpleasant circumstances necessitating our visit, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderer888
Reviews.Content: Based on the rave reviews from tripadvisor we booked a suite in the Melrose Hotel to celebrate a significant event. It was very disappointing to say the least. Yes, the service was impeccable, the bathroom amenities were upscale, and the piano bar was quite nice but the room was in desperate need of a serious overhaul. I felt like I was staying at an old great aunt's slightly smelly, threadbare house. I tend to like old hotels with a lot of character and have never had trouble before but the suite at the Melrose was tired and run down. The sofa and arm chairs were faded, frayed, and shabby looking. The mattress was soft and the bedspread and decorative pillows in need of replacement. Most unpleasant was the very noticeable musty smell in the room that would not go away. If you have allergies to mold I would think twice about staying here. To be honest I am surprised at the high marks given by the tripadvisor reviewers. I wouldn't call the hotel a "dump" but if you want upscale luxury that sparkles choose somewhere else. It just may not be worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MisterTravelFella
Reviews.Content: This hotel continues to offer a great value for the per-night price. The Melrose is an older hotel that has been well-maintained overall. Our room was quite large, at least twice the size of most current hotel rooms. Staff were very friendly and helpful with directions to restaurants. Location is also great, very easy to get to the City's best shopping or to museums (although you will need a car). Also the hotel is located in the epicenter of the Dallas lesbian and gay community, at the intersection of Oak Lawn and Cedar Springs, in easy walking distance to some of the City's most well-known gay bars, boutiques and cafes. We were warmly welcomed, well treated, and quite comfortable-- which isn't always the reception that gay folks get when they come to Texas, even in some of its larger cities. The only downsides are that the hotel has no covered parking, and has no self-parking. Overall, we would recommend the hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Melrose sale Meeting”
Reviews.Author: parcvue
Reviews.Content: Just hosted a sales team meeting at the Melrose and the hotel was great. Nice rooms, great bar, great restaurant and a very caring staff. This hotel is a great value

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: GoBlue_traveller
Reviews.Content: I had a good experience at the Melrose and found the staff very accomodating and helpful. The front desk staff gave me excellent recommendations for nearby restaurants. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and hot chocolate was available in the lobby. The rooms were large and quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. Because of business I wasn't able to get out to see much of Dallas, but I would recommend the Melrose to friends coming to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for the Cedar Springs Halloween Block Party”
Reviews.Author: Lukedelt
Reviews.Content: One of the biggest events during Halloween is the Cedar Springs Block Party. It takes place just outside of the Melrose. My wife and I chose to get a room at the Melrose, which worked out perfectly for the party. The staff was extremely friendly, and the room was clean and well-decorated. The views of the Oak Lawn area were great from our 6th floor suite. I will surely stay here every year for the Halloween party!

Reviews.Title: “Great City Getaway”
Reviews.Author: desertdenizen
Reviews.Content: The Melrose is a Dallas institution and after years of benign neglect has veen brought to it's former glory. After an overseas asssignment, I had a reunion with my oldest friend at the Melrose. Couldn't have been better. The Melrose is like a trip back in time. The rooms are spacious, the amenitieos are noteworthy, and the service is excellent. I managed to forget my passport, but they found it and had it back to me by courier in a day. Located close to Love Field and the Oak Lawn night life, it is a hotel for all lifestyles. Really worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Melrose Dallas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a wedding at The fablious Melrose Hotel in Dallas. Everything was handeled wonderfully. The staff at the hotel is terriffic as was room. From fablious food to a great bar the Melrose was the best hotel expwrience Ive had in many years.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVE THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The most charming, delightful, perfectly relaxing stay in a hotel we've ever had was at the beautiful Melrose Hotel in Dallas, TX recently. Our room was wonderful and a great weekend get-a-way - romantic - fantastic service from the time you drive up to Valet - check in at the front desk and get to your room - and the Library Bar and Landmark Restaurant - well, this really is a Four Diamond experience - impeccable service in every area of this hotel. We were totally pampered and will most certainly come back. Thank you Melrose Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Have Dinner at the Landmark Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Landmark Restaurant in the Melrose Hotel truly is one of Dallas' "Best Kept Secrets!" Wanting a quiet, elegant atmosphere to celebrate my husband's birthday, my family and I were impressed with the classic setting in this beautifully restored luxury hotel. We began to see how the restaurant earned its four-star plus rating when our server, Jennifer, greeted us and described each dish from the amazing menu. When each course arrived, we were delighted! Our dinners exceeded our expectations, and the quality attention from Jennifer and Charlie was outstanding. I highly recommend The Landmark Restaurant for special occasion dining, which might be just dinner for two, entertaining clients or evenings out with friends. You'll want to tell everyone--but then, the Landmark wouldn't be a secret anymore!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service - Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: kbloomh
Reviews.Content: After comparing hotels in Dallas, I reserved a room at the Melrose for my husband and I's 5th Anniversary. This turned out to be a great decision. I had corresponded with Edward Searle prior to our arrival. I asked if I could send some digital pictures from our wedding and if they could put them in the room for when we arrived. Edward said 'not a problem'. I sent the pictures electronically and he had them printed out and framed for when we walked into the living area of our room! My husband was so surprised - it was GREAT! Plus, we had a corner room - and it was magnificent! All in all, I have never encountered the customer service that Edward provided - and for that, I was greatly appreciative. The Melrose is a great place to stay in Dallas. We will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Stay At The Melrose”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: April 2006:- My wife and I had the most fabulous stay last month in Dallas Texas while staying at The Melrose Hotel, Dallas. This historic hotel not only met our expectations, but I would go as far as to say that it exceeded them too. We were very impressed with the quality of service from the minute we arrived. The doormen were very welcoming and most accommodating and we found that the bellmen and reception staff were most cordial and friendly and maintained a level of friendliness that is sometimes hard to find these days in hotels of this level. We had several great dining experiences in their hotel dining room, The Landmark Restaurant. The menu offered a variety of dishes that met our somewhat picky dietary needs, but the service is what I was so impressed with: the staff was never to busy to tend to our needs in a friendly and polite manner. Overall it was a great weekend get-away for my wife and I, and I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star treatment with gorgeous rooms, lobby and lounge!!!”
Reviews.Author: rsamardzia
Reviews.Content: I can't believe that I waited so long to give this jewel of a property a try. I stay in Dallas about 4 to 8 nights a month and have stayed at all of the so called "4 and 5 diamond" properties. None of them in this area (Dallas/Ft. Worth) can touch the service, the ambience or the location of this property. Trust me when I say to all that this is a must try. Once you stay there, I believe you will be hooked. Not only did I feel like a star when I entered the lobby, but I actually saw several current movie and TV stars having a drink in their wonderful lounge. The Melrose Hotel has given me a bunch more reasons to stay in Dallas as much as I can. Thank you, Thank you, Thank you for the wonderful experience!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “So-So Stay at the Melrose Hotel”
Reviews.Author: melissatrv
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a week long conference and all the downtown hotels were already booked. I was trying to decide between Melrose and Renaissance Market Center. Based on reviews here, I booked this hotel. The positives: The staff is friendly and attentive. I have no complaints, superior service A++++. I forgot my tootbrush and they promptly brought one to my room, room service is VERY fast. The rooms are HUGE compared to a standard room. The bathroom is very big. Order the Belgium waffles for breakfast as they are fantastic. Across from a Walgreens which is convenient if you need some necessities. Free wireless access in the lobby, but $10 a day in your room. The negatives or neutrals: The hotel is not really near anything. They advertise that they are near the upscale Turtle Creek neighborhood, which is really nothing spectacular. In fact, I did not feel safe walking around the corner. There is very limited food selection for room service and it is a bit more expensive than some other hotels I have stayed. So you have to go and eat. As I do not rent a car, I have to eat close by. There are no good places to eat in walking distance. There is a cool little vegetarian place called the Cosmic Cafe around the corner that's about it. Also the West Village shopping center 5 minutes away is nothing great. Though I did get great Tirmasu at an Italian place there. Pay the extra cabfare and go to the Galleria Mall or if you want upscale shopping go to Highland Park I am always leery of cleanliness in older hotels. The bathroom tub really needed a good scrubbing with comet. And there was this glob of what probably looked like soap on the bathroom floor. I kept meaning to complain about this but did not have time. And yet the tub never got cleaner and the mystery glob stayed on the bathroom floor the 5 days I was there. The work desk area is poorly lit. There needs to be a light behnd you to illuminate this area more. So at night it is difficult to work at the desk. Fairly limited number of TV stations compared to other hotels. And the workout area consists of the typical hotel equipment, meaning a few cardio machines. Nothing extraordinary. Some members of the room service staff have trouble speaking/understanding English. Twice when I have called they needed someone to call me back who understood me. But to be fair, I was called back right away. The library bar is cool, but drinks are over priced. The Landmark restaurant is very pricey also, and since I did not eat there I cannot comment on the food. I wouldn't say not to stay at this hotel as my stay certainly was not a negative one, however, I would not necessarily recommend it either. If you are looking for things to do, stay at downtown hotel. I had colleagues who stayed at the downtown Hyatt and the Hilton Anatole who said they were fantastic. I will say Trip Advisor is usually on the money with reviews and I am suprised this hotel is rated in the top 5 in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Bonus Points with the Boss”
Reviews.Author: jengator
Reviews.Content: I have become so addicted to Tripadvisor that I always check first before making reservations be it for business or leisure. I've not been home 24 hours but I had to write about the Melrose hotel which I decided on after reading other reviews; I was not disapointed. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was out of this world. I taveled to the Dallas to give a presentation, and we decided to get a conf. room at the hotel to have our meeting. The staff went out of their way to help us, impressed our clients and impressed my boss. Honestly- I've never seen such service and I travel all over the place, all the time. Amazing- if I go back to Dallas, I'm staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: maxster
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the wonderful Melrose. A former frequent guest of the Crescent Court, the Melrose has it all over them for service, warmth, and the true definition of hospitality. From the moment you enter, you feel as though you are home. The Bar is fabulous, the food excellent, and the Front Desk staff is second to none, especially Michael. And..for the business traveler, the location is fantastic and you can actually walk places. Thanks again to all and see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Melrose Hotel - Dallas Texas - Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow!!! That is all I can say about the wonderful stay I had at the Melrose Hotel Dallas Texas. The place is beautiful, the staff are attentive, the food was excellent, and the service was great. I used Trip Advisor to decide between the Melrose Hotel and another one. Based on the recommendations I read, I went with the Melrose Hotel. The time I spent reading reviews was well worth the effort. I couldn't have been more satisfied. The bathroom itself was huge and had a very spa like feel!!!! The room was very clean. The room service breakfast was fantastic. You also have to try the Library (bar) and must experience the Landmark Restaurant. In addition, there is a shuttle service that runs in the very immediate area (like a mile or two radius)to any location and will also pick up in the same radius. The drivers were very pleasant and courteous. I highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, historic hotel. Friendly staff. Did not have a chance to try the LandMark restaurant for dinner but the breakfast was very good. Since it was our first time to Dallas, we chose to take a taxi to the Opera (Music Hall) and a Dallas Cowboys game. It was the best decision since traffic was quite heavy during the weekend. Hotel is walking distance to several shops and restaurants. If you are sensitive to noises, choose a room away from the street "Cedar Springs". The street is home to a local fire department station.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay at The Melrose”
Reviews.Author: Gippy26
Reviews.Content: What a terrific property!! This was my first stay at The Melrose and you can bet I'll be back. I'm often times a bit leary of older properties, but The Melrose lived up to my expectations of a first class hotel in every possible way. The staff (from the doorman to the front desk personnel) were excellent and very friendly. I had a large corner room that was super clean, as well as a very comfortable bed. The only draw back was the rather small bathroom...not really anyplace for one's toliletries. The only other small complaint was very slow running elevators. A number of people mentioned to me that they ended up taking the stairs because the wait had been so long. I did not utilize the bar or restaurant but they looked great. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nickled and dimed at a shabby Melrose”
Reviews.Author: KSLB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected the Melrose hotel for our recent weekend stay in Dallas based on user reviews at Tripadvisor, and the hotel's "bargain" rate of $129 available on their website. We drove, thus adding a hefty $16 a day for parking, another $10.95 to gain internet access (either wireless or wired in the room), and then endured a tired and shabby room, with a poor location on the backside of the hotel, when clearly the hotel was nearly empty. Here's what we didn't like about the room condition: stained and tired furniture and bedcoverings; a weird halo of darker stained stone flooring adjacent to the toilet (ahem....), wood surfaces on furniture water damaged and scratched, broken coffee pot, leaky faucet in the shower/bathtub, and the worst: delighted to find a pot of lip balm in a hotel, only to open and discover the swirl of someone else's fingerprint -- gross! There were some perks: housekeeping was gracious in bringing an extra pillow and towel, the desk clerk and valet parking folks were friendly and efficient, the lobby is gorgeous and Sunday champagne brunch in the Landmark restaurant for $32 is elegant and tasty. We also enjoyed the dressing table in the bathroom and the mouthwash! Would we go back? No. The Melrose feels tired, lacks amenities like internet access (no heavenly bed here...), or something a little more for guests in the morning than coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay - but bring your earplugs...”
Reviews.Author: Flip_flop_Queen
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Melrose and also attended a wedding there. The wedding was beautiful with great food and a very nice bar. Our room was quite comfortable with a large bathroom for such an old hotel. The only issue I discovered was how paper-thin the walls are! We could hear almost every word of our neighbor's conversation through all hours of the night. So, word to the wise - bring your earplugs if you plan on getting any sleep at the Melrose Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: DrFryeTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Just returned with my wife from the Melrose. We flew to Dallas for business and to pick up our new puppy from a breeder. We had arranged to stay at the Cooper Clinic Guest Lodge and then found out they were not "pet-friendly" and had to change hotels at the last minute. We booked The Melrose because for a $50 fee you can have a pet there. When we arrived Valet was friendly and convenient. We were given a great rate that included breakfast and valet parking. Less than $200. Upon check-in we were upgraded to a corner king suite for no charge. The staff was friendly and the lobby nice. This is definitely a smaller boutique-type hotel. The location is not bad. However, there is a very large alternative lifestyle community right around the corner if that bothers you. If you drive down the Oak Lawn a ways you end up at a beautiful neighborhood with a great outdoor shopping mall. The best thing about the hotel was the restaurant and bar. The food was just rated 5 stars and we definitely would agree. Every meal was excellent. I would recommend the frozen lemon souffle for dessert. The one negative was the room was just OKAY. The comforter had some stains and the furniture looked worn. I was glad they upgraded us. Inspite of the just okay room, we would consider staying again because of the very friendly staff, location, and excellent food!! Last year we stayed at the four seasons and it would have to be ranked higher than the Melrose. However, it is hard to compete with the four seasons, especially when you are comparing it to a boutique hotel with no pool and very few amenities.
